adventure_overview: Tigers will discover the fundamentals of the engineering process of designing, building, and improving. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Think about something that you would like to build.  Draw a picture of what the final project should look like.

activities.name: My Project Plan Drawing
activities.description: Draw something that you are going to build before you build it.

requirements.text: Using your drawing as a guide, build the project.

activities.name: Crossing the River
activities.description: Cub Scouts build a model of something that will help the den cross a river.

activities.name: Cub Scout Land
activities.description: Make a model of an amusement park ride.

requirements.text: When completed, discuss with your Tiger adult partner what could be done to improve  your project.

activities.name: Room For Improvement
activities.description: Identify ways that your project could be improved.

requirements.text: Make the improvement to your project.

activities.name: Making it Better
activities.description: Make improvement on the model made in requirement 2 based on feedback from the den.

requirements.text: Make a drawing of your final project.

activities.name: Comparing Start to Finish
activities.description: Compare the original drawing to the final project model.
